intro: Bupleurum falcatum f. subspathulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which is known for its aromatic compounds and medicinal uses. This form of Bupleurum is noted for its horticultural value and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
